meanings.definition: A call or shout used to attract attention or communicate over a distance.
meanings.sent1: The cooeys of the hikers echoed through the valley.
meanings.sent2: I heard distant cooeys coming from the forest.
meanings.sent3: The cooeys of the children playing hide-and-seek filled the park.
meanings.sent4: Her cooeys of excitement could be heard from miles away.
meanings.sent5: The eerie cooeys in the night sent shivers down my spine.

meanings.definition: To call out or shout in order to attract attention or communicate over a distance.
meanings.sent1: She cooeys for help when she's lost in the woods.
meanings.sent2: The coach cooeys instructions to the players on the field.
meanings.sent3: He cooeys to his friend across the crowded room.
meanings.sent4: The protesters cooeys their demands outside the government building.
meanings.sent5: The teacher cooeys the students to gather around for a group activity.
